subject: Economics
title: The Metaverse Economy: Virtual Worlds, Real Money
description: A quick win: understand The Metaverse Economy: Virtual Worlds, Real Money.

hook.text: A plot of virtual land in Decentraland sold for $2.4 million. Nothing physical changed hands. The buyer owns pixels.

buildup.text: Virtual economies now generate real value.

discovery.text: Economists study virtual worlds as test labs.

twist.text: Most metaverse investments crashed after the hype. Virtual real estate lost 90% of its value.

climax.text: Virtual economies reveal that value is social agreement.

punchline.text: In virtual worlds, the economics are real. Only the land is fake.

quiz.question: Why do economists study virtual game economies?
options: Games are more important than real economies
They serve as test labs for economic theories
Virtual money is replacing real money
